# Introduction

We assume that the Culmen Depth ($X$) of penguins follows a Normal distribution: $$ X \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu, \sigma^2) $$

# Theoretical Framework

## Derivation of MLE

The likelihood function for $n$ i.i.d. observations is: $$ L(\mu, \sigma^2) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi\sigma^2}} \exp\left(-\frac{(x_i - \mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right) $$
